page.title: 03A dairy farmer's typical day
page.content: Before dawn the dairy farmer drives the herd of sixty Friesians from their straw littered building to the collecting yard to be milked.He lets the first eight cows into the parlour, to feed on concentrates while they are milked by the electrically powered milking machine.When the collecting tank is full of cooled milk it is syphoned out by a milk tanker and taken away to be bottled. The electrified fence is set near the silage clamp so the cows can reach their ration. Three times a day the farmer clears away the slurry with a tractor and scraper .Before afternoon milking he must spread fifty bales of litter straw. By bedtime he has checked each cow.If one is calving he may stay to help.
